title: If the pressure of a liquid increases two times, what will be the boiling point of the liquid? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pressure increases then boiling point increases. For example as we go to high altitudes where pressure is low then boiling point also decreases so water starts boiling at temperature lower then 100°C.
If the pressure of a liquid increases two times, what will be the boiling point of the liquid? There is not enough information given to provide an answer.
